text: So much capital flows to SV VC funds, NY hedge funds, or FLA golf courses. What if family offices in cities like NOLA, Memphis & cities across the US committed to invest just 10% of their wealth locally through #OpportunityZones ? Keep local wealth local. @bruce_katz//t.co/PkoKTEnFFW

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: Remote work is working for us.//t.co/TvJyze0Exs

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @scottbelsky I would beg to differ. If that was the issue then we would be supply-constrained and it's quite the opposite. This year over 1M college educated Americans will apply to join Upwork and we only have work for ~1% of them.

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @scottbelsky + Consistently declining worker mobility + quality of life + Increase in location-agnostic jobs, powered by technology (broadband, cloud tools, video conf) + Generational shift (digital natives much more comfortable with remote work) Oh, and @Upwork, maybe, a little bit?

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @andreasklinger @rrhoover LOL. Yes. That. (Also: early stage companies are much more likely to adopt remote work from the get go, it's harder for older companies to make the switch... And companies started since the mid-2000s represent a bigger and bigger slice of the pie).

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @rrhoover It's much higher: companies either allow remote work (and a minority of those are fully distributed) or they don't. When they don't, the % is 0 (obviously) and when they do it's a lot higher than the 3-5% in her report. What has changed is the % of companies that allow remote.

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: If #SmartCities involves packing more vehicles onto already congested streets and highways, that's really a dumb and regressive use of information and communications technology. True progress is using it to decentralize knowledge work and eliminating the daily commute.

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @PennelDenis @mercer @WECglobal @WECeurope I'd go for 3: - rise of automation (AI and robots) - acceleration of skills changes (and thus need for reskilling and lifelong learning) - rise of the freelancers

name: Stephane Kasriel
text: @stevesi And their losses are 10x higher than any hypothetical cost saving from switching away from cloud. Real issue here is driver incentives, cost of insurance, overall pricing in hyper competitive / low differentiation space. AWS is a rounding error.
